Hi Mike, 

Interesting thoughts. But, in some complex systems, it's just no=
t feasible to have all tests run independently of each other. For example, =
in my case, the nightly job needs to do it's work, before I can do one of t=
he tests. Furthermore, to verify that the whole process actually works, fro=
m start to finish, would be impossible with independent tests. i.e. I would=
 not really be testing the nightly job. 

But yes, I think setting up a tes=
t, that is not dependant on any other test, is possible, but I would have t=
o hard code a bunch of stuff in the tests, and I would have to put all of t=
he tests in a single test, in order for them to succeed. And doing that wou=
ld prevent a bit of my actual code from being tested. 

One other question =
is, can I trust the order of execution of the test methods in a single Test=
Case implemention? Or are all of them also supposed to be independent? 

Th=
e reason I ask is because this is what is basically happening: There is an =
external ASYNCHRONOUS SOAP messaging system that is the core to all communi=
cation between several companies. Requests/responses can be sent to and fro=
m all of the participating parties. For testing purposes, so that my tests =
can be a little more controlled, I send requests and responses to and from =
my own server. i.e. I do not send to other companies, because I cannot guar=
antee they will respond within the time I need (seconds), even though techn=
ically, their test systems are supposed to be up and running. 

Also note t=
hat this is a cronjob, likely run once every night. 

1. submit request to =
my system, through the external system. This is effectively to test receivi=
ng requests from the external system, to me. i.e. I can send requests to my=
self, as if they were coming from someone else's system. 
2. receive reques=
t from external system 
3. queue job for nightly build of data 
4. check fo=
r available data from nightly job, the next day 
5. send available data 
6.=
 receive the data sent in #5, and email it out to a staff member 

So, what=
 we have here, is a complex messaging system that is not internally control=
led. I agree that the majority of testing, with most projects, does not inv=
olve complex scenarios like this, with so many dependencies on other system=
s. And, generally, you could write independent tests. But, with something l=
ike this, where your tests are actually tests to make sure that your commun=
ication with the messaging system works, it is extremely difficult to make =
tests independent of each other. 

The way I see it, there is only two ways=
 to make testing this scenario work. 
1. put all of the tests in a single t=
est, and have delays or polling to wait for the messages to come through, a=
nd declare them all successful if it succeeds, or all failed if they fail. =

2. have tests depend on the completion of each other, and have delays or p=
olling to wait for the messages to come through. 

Any other insight, that =
would make this easier to test, would be HIGHLY appreciated. I am pretty ne=
w to JUnit, and don't have a whole lot of experience with automated testing=
 in general.
